Posts.Content: Jul 16, 2009 12:48PM - edited Jul 16, 2009 12:49PM by KittyBaby Tweeterbeeker, My first post, was wondering if you'd share the name(s) of the Baltimore area docs you'd mentioned who do reconstruction?  The ones who do DIEP.  Thanks!
Posts.Title: Prophylactic BLM for ADH? HelloFromCT Daudine

Posts.Content: Jul 21, 2009 09:29PM KittyBaby wrote: Thanks tweeterbeeker, your recommendations are much appreciated.  I'd ordered Kathy Steligo's  book, and it should be in Friday.  Just learned that my BRCA came back negative, which was excellent news (strong family history of breast/ovarian).  Biopsy last month showed ADH in right, about 7mm area on MRI; i have no idea if this is considered big? small?  Have always had calcifications, and have very dense breasts, no children, age 54.  Now that BRCA is negative, i'm back to thinking that the lumpectomy scheduled for Aug 4 is the way to go, rather than bilateral prophy mastectomy.  I greatly appreciate everyone's help here!  We lost my 52 year-old sister last Sept to  bc, which was diagnosed as Stage 3 -- she lived only about 4 years after diagnosis.  So, I'm scared and confused still about what to do.
